body:
Navigate to the page you want to edit. You can navigate to a page using one of the links in the top navigation bar:

- Dashboard
- Page flow
- Preview mode
- Wysiwyg mode

## Editing using 'instance mode'

Instance mode lists all the properties you can edit on that page.

If youâ€™ve not set all the mandatory properties, a message at the top will tell you what to do. 

## Editing using 'Wysiwyg mode'

Wysiwyg shows you the visual components on a page. Click on the symbols next to the part of the page you want to edit.

## Click the green 'Update' button to save your changes

When you edit part of a page, there's a green update button. Click this to make and save your changes.

This updates the JSON in your service's files.
 
## What each property does 

- **Based on**: makes the page inherit values from another page
- **Url**: relative url for the page
- **Heading**: sets the H1
- **Lede**: sets the first paragraph after the H1
- **Content**: sets the body content
- **Enable steps**: allows this page to have steps that follow from it
- **Steps**: sets the steps that follow from this page
- **Primary action**: sets a string (or key to look up a string) to use for the page's primary action (such as the main button)
- **Section heading**: sets the content to use as the page's section heading
- **Steps heading**: sets the content to use as the section heading on pages which are this page's steps
- **Repeatable**: lets you add repeatable form elements to the page
- **Logical properties**: sets the conditions for whether a page should be shown
- **Additional properties**: sets the html <title> tag and any additional components
heading: Editing pages
